I'm Ben.

About Me

I'm a mechanical engineer by training, a software engineer by self-training, and a generalist by nature.

My professional experience is in the areas of:

  • small (2-5 person) team management.
  • full-system motorcycle testing and development.
  • surgical instrument design and testing.
  • surgical instrument test protocol development.
  • single-pitch rock climbing instruction.

I am currently seeking contract work on small teams (2-15 person). I am excited about work where I can apply both software and mechanical engineering skills or interact with users and customers. I am based in Redwood City, CA and Madison, WI.

Photo by Photo- to-Canvas.com on Unsplash

Auris Health

Sr. Mechanical Engineer - Instruments
Technical Lead - Instrument Performance
Oct. 2017 - Jan. 2020
  • Led 6-person team to quantify and improve instrument performance through instrument hardware changes. Effort culminated in readout to project management and 50% reduction in instrument command-following errors.
  • Led instrument cleaning studies to evaluate reusability and quantify bioburden post-cleaning. Defined soiling, cleaning, and soil extraction protocols. Coordinated testing with external laboratories.
  • Managed 2-person team which developed instrument performance, life, and cleaning testing. Worked with team to prioritize tasks, balance workloads, and improve internal processes.
  • Developed prototype end effectors based on the results of analytic calculations and sub-system-level testing. Prototype end effectors improved instrument life and surgical driving performance.
  • Developed team processes for supporting in-house surgical operations. Coordinated support amongst 30-person team and, following development, put steps in place to help process run itself.
